resource.chars:
<u>Structure of the arms <\u>
I have not been able to convince 
myself of the existence of tha spiral 
arrangement of the muscular fibres of 
the arms which has been described 
in <u>Rhynchonella <\u> & <u>Waldheimia <\u> -
I have found the wall of the hollow 
cylinder of the arm to be constituted 
1. Externally by an Epithelium within 
which lie 2. The reticulated canals 
which have been already described 
3. By a delicate layer of longitudinal 
or more oblique & transverse fibres 
which are probably muscular &
4th most internally a peculiar epithelial 
layer 
In <u>Rhynchonella <\u> the bases of the 
arms are terminated by two considerable 
sacs which project upwards into the
